response.job_title: Mechanical Engineer - National University of Colombia
response.summary: Mechanical Engineer with a post-graduate title in HSEQ Integrated Management Systems, knowledge on allothermal and autothermal gasification equipment, and high quality biomass briquettes manufacturing processes. I also have professional experience with multiple CAD software for the Oil & Gas industry, such as CADWorx, AVEVA and AutoCAD.
response.skills: Lenguajes de programación, Microsoft Office, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint, Sistema de gestión de la calidad, Sistemas de Gestión de Salud, Seguridad y Medio ambiente, Autodesk Inventor, SolidWorks, Solid Edge

profile_positions.description: I work as a CAD Administrator, focused on setting up piping specifications with CADWorx Specification Editor, which includes data table customization, pipe supports and user shapes creation (with both basic and complex features), and description formatting. I'm also a member of company's CAD HelpDesk, which is in charge of giving engineering software support in terms of license management, troubleshooting and new software RFQs. Last but not least, I fulfill specific AVEVA E&I Administration tasks in AVEVA E&I Wiring Manager and E3D, related to cable management.
profile_positions.title: Mechanical Engineering Associate I, Product Support

profile_positions.description:
Using Autodesk Inventor, I modeled nineteen metallic structures which then went through detailed FEA studies. After identifying optimal load conditions, visualization drawings were made and given as part of the requested deliverables.

Based on previously given dimensional information, I modeled a device called Coil Spider and generated manufacturing drawings, all using Autodesk Inventor.
profile_positions.title: Contractor

company.name: Audubon Companies
company.description:
Audubon is a leading provider of engineering, procurement, construction (EPC), consulting, fabrication, and technical field services to the energy, chemicals, power, infrastructure, and industrial markets. With proven industry experience, innovative technologies, and data-driven insight, we bring domain experience and technical excellence to deliver robust project solutions—safely and sustainably.

Our EPC capabilities span the entire asset life cycle—from feasibility study and conceptual design to inspection and testing to decommissioning. Our multidisciplinary expertise covers engineering and design, automation and control, modular fabrication, construction, operations and maintenance, and field services like right-of-way and surveying. We are supporting the future of energy by providing our clients with carbon capture, environmental compliance, hydrogen, wind, and solar solutions. With inherent flexibility, a commitment to process and human safety, and proven project success, we create efficiencies for our clients to achieve their business, operational, and sustainability goals.

As a company, we prioritize people, safety, and service excellence. Since 1997, our values have remained at the core of who we are and what we do: accountability, efficiency, enthusiasm, ingenuity, integrity, and quality.
